column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$5$I have been prescribed this twice for pain. Once for pleurisy pain and now for kidney stones. Supposed to take one every 6 hours. It takes 2 hours for Tramadol to begin easing pain SLIGHTLY
column3: then it only works for about 2 hours. Thus I suffer for the last two hours before time to take next dose. doc said to take with Extra Strength Tylenol to increase pain relief effectiveness. Pitiful excuse for pain reliever but doc won't give me anything stronger despite being his patient for 11 years. Time to shop for new doctor.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have taken this medication for 2 yrs now due to nerve damage.  I have had no issues with interactions or side effects.  It has worked so well that I thought it was not working
column3: but if I skip just one dose I definitely feel the difference.  It keeps my hand from cramping and curling into claws on heavy days at work.

65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I had Restless Leg Syndrome
column7: and some other problems. I've been taking Tramadol for over 9 years now and if I run out of it I will end up in the emergency room. before this 9 year period
column8: I was seeing a psychiatrist regularly and had many hospitalizations for mental problems for over 20 years before I started Tramadol. None of their psychiatric medications worked very well. Since I have been taking Tramadol (9 Years Now)I have not had to see a psychiatrist. There are some bad side effects such as memory loss
column12: but the benefits greatly outweigh the side effects. I have had to adjust the amounts over the years and now taking two 50MG tabs three times daily. This seems to be the best for me. I believe solving the lower back pains has been the major part of solving my problems.
